page.title: 11Hellesdon's Daisy Ashford
page.content: Margaret Mary Julia(Daisy) Ashford born 1881,in Elm Lodge, Petersham.This was where Charles Dickens lived when he wrote "Nicolas Nickleby". At age four she reputedly dictated a story to her father who wrote it down.At 9 yrs. she produced her masterpiece: "The Young Visitors", an insight into middle class society of Victorian England. The book was published in 1919. Daisy came to Norfolk in 1920 with her husband James Derbin. They later moved to Low Rd Hellesdon but from 1955 until her death in 1972 she lived with her daughter Mrs Margaret Steel in Woodland Rd,Hellesdon.Most of her books were written before she left school. It was not until her mother died in 1917 that the red notebook containing Â£The Young Visitors' was found.She was 38 when it was published. Daisy was a resident of Hellesdon for 33 years.
